title: Py-pillow: New simd version can't be targetted in packages.yaml, doesn't automatically concretize to 7.0.0.post33

labels.name: triage
labels.description: The issue needs to be prioritized

body:
<!-- Explain, in a clear and concise way, the command you ran and the result you were trying to achieve.
Example: "I ran `spack find` to list all the installed packages and ..." -->

@adamjstewart This is on MacOS with the current spack develop branch. The only way I've found to properly set the new pillow version is to explicitly use ^py-pillow-simd in the spec.

### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ spack spec paraview@5.8.1+python3
...
        ^py-pillow-simd@7.0.0%clang@10.0.1-apple~freetype~imagequant+jpeg~jpeg2000~lcms~tiff~webp~webpmux~xcb+zlib arch=darwin-mojave-haswell

$ spack config get packages
...
  pil:
    version: [7.0.0.post3]
  py-pillow:
    version: [7.0.0.post3]
  py-pillow-simd:
    version: [7.0.0.post3]

$ spack spec paraview@5.8.1+python3 ^py-pillow-simd@7.0.0.post3
...
        ^py-pillow-simd@7.0.0.post3%clang@10.0.1-apple~freetype~imagequant+jpeg~jpeg2000~lcms~tiff~webp~webpmux~xcb+zlib arch=darwin-mojave-haswell

```


### Additional information

<!-- These boxes can be checked by replacing [ ] with [x] or by clicking them after submitting the issue. -->
- [x] I have run `spack debug report` and reported the version of Spack/Python/Platform
```console
$ spack debug report
* **Spack:** 0.15.4-846-fab2622a7
* **Python:** 3.6.10
* **Platform:** darwin-mojave-haswell
```
- [x] I have searched the issues of this repo and believe this is not a duplicate
- [ ] I have run the failing commands in debug mode and reported the output

If you want to ask a question about the tool (how to use it, what it can currently do, etc.), try the `#general` channel on our Slack first. We have a welcoming community and chances are you'll get your reply faster and without opening an issue.
